title: Around the Districts : Ballymore - Mayglass to Clonard
body_text:
Around the Districts: Ballymore-Mayglass to Clonard
BALLYMORE-MAYGLASS
Quid Games night
St Fintans recently held their Quid Games Night in the Talbot Hotel. A great night was had by all. The overall winner on the night after a mighty battle was Johnny Kelly who will now go on to represent the club in the Wexford GAA Gala night in Whites Hotel on 18th April where the winning club will take away €10,000. Many thanks to all 6 contestants on the night who gave us some great laughs. Also many thanks to our contestants sponsors on the night who support is always appreciated. Best of luck to Johnny in the Grand Final.
St Fintans Club sponsor
St Fintans Club are proud to announce Fuinneamh Renewables and local Mayglass man Peter Hughes as their new club sponsor for the next 3 years. Fuinneamh renewables specialise in solar energy and offer a wide range of commercial and domestic electrical and solar services. Keep an eye out for the new jerseys.
Easter GAA Camp
St Fintans are delighted to announce that they will be hosting this year’s Easter GAA Camp on 23rd & 24th April. The camp will take place in Ballymore & is for Junior Infants to 6th Class pupils from both Mayglass & Broadway Schools. Places are limited so early booking is recommended, there is a small charge of €10 per child to cover running costs. For further info or for booking please text or What’s App 086-8930057
Chair Exercise
Interested in Chair Exercise classes? This class will include exercises in the chair as well as standing exercises using the chair as support. Focus will include movements for balance, mobility, stability and flexibility.
Classes are held on Thursdays 10-11am at the Ballycogley Community Hall and all are welcome. Please contact Jodi at 087 414 4006 with your availability and interest.
Dancing
Dance practice continues in Ballycogley hall on Wednesdays from 7.30pm to 9.30pm. Why not give it a go. For further information please call 086 4088418.
Club Lotto
The St Fintans GAA club in association with St Mary’s Rosslare hold its fundraising lotto each Tuesday evening. Tickets for the draw cost €2 and are available from the usual seller’s or from any committee member. The jackpot now stands at €15,000. The numbers drawn were 2,8,22,32. We thank you for your continued and generous support.
GAA Nursery 2025
The St Fintans GAA club its Easter camp to its nursery children for one hour each day. The camp is open to children that will be joining our nursery for the upcoming season (starting junior infants in September). The children will be introduced to their new coaches, play some fun games and make some new friends. Please send a WhatsApp to Rich on 086 8930057 to register and secure a place.
Easter Ceremonies
The Easter ceremonies in our parish are as follows: Holy Thursday Mayglass church at 7.30pm, Good Friday Ballymore church at 4pm. Easter vigil mass in Mayglass church at 7.30pm and Ballymore vigil mass at 8.30pm Holy Saturday night. Easter Sunday mass in Ballymore at 9am. We wish to say a special thanks to Fr Murphy and Fr Cogley for looking after our Easter ceremonies in our parish as it is very much appreciated. Wishing everyone a very happy Easter.
National Schools
Congratulations to the girls of Mayglass and Broadway national schools who were presented with their Gaelic football district final medals at an evening of celebration in Ballycogley hall during the past week. Leah Ormonde made the presentation while the parents association supplied and served the refreshments. A magical evening was had by all.
Honoured
An all round sportsman and notable darts player inducted into the American hall of fame Ballycogley man Billy O Brien was honoured with a civic reception in Wexford county hall during the recent past. A lifetime in sport and it was fitting that he should be recognised for his contribution to it all. Well done Billy and we’re sure it’s not over yet.
Club and County Draw
The St Fintans GAA club is selling tickets for the annual club and county draw and will be once again calling on your support. There will be three draws with a total prize money of €100,000. The first draw will take place on April 30th with the other two draws taking place in May. Tickets are costing €50 and may be purchased in two payments of €20 and €30 and are Available from any club member.
Underage GAA
The current period is a busy one at under age level for the teams of Our Lady’s Island/St Fintans. The u-26 football team took on and defeated St Mary’s ( Maudlintown) in a Div 5 league game. Clongeen was the venue where the u-18 football team of Bargy Gaels was fixed to play moguegeen Gaels. The u-14 football team was to play Taghmon/ Camross in a championship game in Carne while the u-16 hurling team had Marshalstown/Casyledockrell as its opponent in a Div 5 league game.
Yoga
Join us for yoga at Ballycogley Community Hall, Wednesday 10-11am. Beginning/Gentle Yoga for beginners or those wanting a gentler approach. Or join us on Saturdays, 10-11amCommunity Yoga for all including flow sequences as well as static and dynamic poses to increase strength, mobility, flexibility and balance. Bring your mat, large towel and water. Contact Jodi with interest or any questions at 087 4144006.
Notes
If you wish to have any items included in the notices for Ballymore/Mayglass you may do so by email at conzarcat@hotmail.com or by contacting Paddy at 087 9680419. As this coming weekend is a bank holiday, we should receive the notices on or before 7pm on Thursday evening.
BANNOW-BALLYMITTY
Ballymitty NS 75th Anniversary
Calling all past pupils, staff, community members and friends of Ballymitty NS – We are having our 75th School Anniversary celebrations on Saturday 24th May.
Come along to Ballymitty NS from 3-7pm that day to meet with old friends, walk the corridors and share stories over a cuppa!
We are having a mass to celebrate our school at 7.15pm that evening in Ballymitty Church. Finally, you are all welcome to come to Tullycanna Pub for a Grand School Reunion – meet with friends and celebrate the night away! Raffle and refreshments on the night!
Teach na nOg CLG AGM
This year’s Annual General Meeting for Teach na nOg will take place on 29th April at 7.30 pm at the Teach na nOg building.
The AGM will include a report on the finances and main activities of the year. Parents of children in the preschool and parents of children planning to attend the preschool in the following year are encouraged to attend the AGM.
Social Dancing
Dancing continues in Carrig Community Centre this Wednesday 16th April with music by Teddy and Cathal Barry, Wednesday 23rd Glen Flynn, Wednesday 30th Silver Moon Dance Band (its first Wexford gig).
Split the pot
Congratulations to Anne Davy on winning the handball club’s split the pot of €238. This week’s Split the pot winner was Breda Carr €248.
5K Charity Walk
The annual 5km walk in aid of Grantstown Daycare Centre will take place Bank Holiday Monday 5thMay. Registration from 10.30am, the walk will start at 11am sharp from Grantstown Church. High Vis Vests must be worn. Tea/Coffee and snacks for everyone on their return. Adults €10/Teens €5/Under 12s free. Please contact us at 051 561016 if you would like to support but cannot attend on the day. All support gratefully appreciated.
Kiltra School of music
The Kiltra School of Music Adult Singers and Youth Choir featuring Kiltra Youth Orchestra presents a wonderful showtime concert of 100 Years of Broadway at the National Opera House, Jerome Hynes Theatre, on Saturday 26th April at 7.30pm and Sunday 27th April at 5pm. Book now at National Opera House Box Office 053 9122144 or nationaloperahouse.ie.
Ballymitty hall - dates for diary
Monday Night Bingo – Ballymitty Drive-in Bingo Monday nights at 8pm, Ballymitty Church Carpark
Car boot & market – unfortunately Ballymitty Carboot will not be back this year due to low attendance and footfall.
Women’s Shed – Ballymitty Hall. Monday mornings from 10am to 12pm. All welcome to come join.
BBCT Community Games
BBCT (Bannow/Ballymitty/Clongeen/Taghmon) Community Games Split the Pot. €5 per ticket, draw will take place in Taghmon Athletics club, on Wednesday 30th April. Payment via Cash or Revolut 086 3066150. Check out BBCT facebook page for more information.
County Talent finals are on 10th May in Bree: Talent solo U13 and U16 -Solo Dance/Solo Music/Solo Recitation/-Solo Singing; Talent group U13 and U16 — group dance–Irish contemporary /Modern and Disco; Group drama and comedy / group Music / group Singing. All entries by 1st May. Contact Maria 0861943483, Phyllis 0879966185 or Anne 083 3153216
Well done to all participants in the Art & Handwriting competition. The 1st 3 in each event went through to the County event in Barntown National School on Sunday 6th April. Results as follows
ART - U8 Girls First Ivy Harpur (Bannow) Second Ella Keating (Clongeen) and Third Molly Whitty (Ballymitty). U10 Girls First Cora Titler (Clongeen), Second Eimear O’Connor (Taghmon) and Third Sadie Reville (Caroreigh). U12 Girls First Cadhla Cullen (Clongeen), Second Layla Lovat (Ballymitty) and Third Ava O’Sullivan (Taghmon). U14 Girls First Zara Byrne (Taghmon), Second Erin Reville (Caroreigh) and Third Annabelle McGee. U16 Girls First Àine O’Connor (Taghmon)
U8 Boys First Sebastian Almeida (Ballymitty), Second Whelan (Clongeen)and Third James O’Connor (Taghmon); U10 Boys First Mikey Lawlor Ryan (Taghmon), Second Alan Radwaski (Taghmon) and Third Finley Cullen (Clongeen); U12 Boys First Vasyl Lebedyk (Clongeen), Second Dara Crosbie (Ballymitty) and Third Eoghan Cullen (Clongeen); U14 Boys First Robert Lee Banville (Caroreigh), SecondTyler Kavanagh (Caroreigh) and Third Darragh Bennett (Clongeen)
HANDWRITING - U10 Girls First Sienna Butler (Clongeen), Second Roise O’Sullivan (Clongeen) and Third Cora Titler (Clongeen); U12 girls First Ava Lawlor Ryan (Taghmon), Second Amber Byrne (Clongeen) and Third Ava O’Sullivan (Taghmon); U14 Girls First Éimhín O’Sullivan (Clongeen), Second Erin Reville (Caroreigh) and Third Aideen Monaghan (Taghmon)
U10 Boys First Tristan Butler (Clongeen), Second Evan Colfer (Clongeen) and Third Danny Bennett (Clongeen); U12 boys First Robbie Jacob (Clongeen), Second Vasyl Lebedyk (Clongeen) and Third Sean Cullen (Clongeen); U14 Boys First Joshua Butler (Clongeen), Second Daniel Redmond (Clongeen) and Third Nicholas Winters (Taghmon).
BREE-GALBALLY
Bree United Cabaret
A great night lined up this Easter Sunday 20th April for Bree United’s annual cabaret night with live music from Vinny Murphy in Hammel’s Of Bree. €5 entry on the door and raffle prizes also on the night, Entry tickets at the door on the night and from team managers.
Bree AC News
Bree AC is hosting a Table Quiz in Hammels of Bree on Thursday, 17th April at 9pm. The club AGM and Presentation of Awards Night is on Tuesday, 29th April.
Daffodil Day
Enniscorthy Daffodil Day 2025 was a great success and a total of €12,615.71 was raised for the Irish Cancer Society. Thanks to all the volunteers who made this possible including those who gave fresh daffodils, wrapped the daffodils, those who stood outside the 6 locations in town to collect donations and all those who came out on the day and gave so generously. All monies collected in Enniscorthy returns in services such as free drivers to bring patients to and from cancer treatment safely, night nursing care, that allows patients at the end of life to remain at home with their loved ones, counselling, and free
access to daffodil centre nurses. We will be back again next year to continue fundraising for the Irish Cancer Society.
Clothing Collection
The Parents Association of Bree National School will hold a clothing collection at the school gates on Tuesday 6th May 6-8pm and on Wednesday 7th May 8.45-10am. Clothing, shoes, belts, handbags, schoolbags, curtains, bedsheets and suitcases in working order will be accepted. No duvets, pillows, cushions or soft toys.
Scoil Mhuire Ballyhogue
Wise Owls Afterschool will be providing a Before and After school childcare service in the school commencing September 2025. The service will operate from 2pm-6pm Monday-Friday during term time and from 8am-9am each morning. We are still also taking enrolments for 2025/2026 please email secretary@scoilmhuireballyhogue, call 053 92 47677 or view our website www.scoilmhuireballyhogue.ie if you require an application form.
Bree Hub
Hot desks are available at €10 daily rates at The Hub, Bree Community Centre. Contact their new email address at info@bree.ie for further information.
Community Games News
Bree Davidstown Cloughbawn quiz team won the silver medals at the County Quiz Finals in Bree on Thursday evening to secure qualification for the National Final in Kilkenny on the first Saturday in July. Team members are Liam Leacy, Paidi Moriarty, Conor Kelly and Lily Fay with subs Roisin Fay and Meabh Cahill. Roisin and Meabh along with Jack Fallon and Seimi Moriarty also performed well to finish mid way of the seventeen teams competing in Bree on Thursday evening.
The Co Gymnastics took place on Saturday last with medal success for three local gymnasts. Hannah Murphy U9 and Cian Murray U11 won the gold medals to qualify for the National Final. Eve Murray won the Bronze medal in the U9s. Also taking part were Grace Murphy, Anna Murphy and Mary Kate Kirwan U11 and Abi Furlong U13.
Best wishes to the local handballers taking part in their Co Final on this Friday evening in Taghmon.
Scoil Eoin Baiste Galbally
Galbally National School is excited to announce a new Breakfast Club service starting in September 2025. This service will be available from 8am each morning within school term times. Our Afterschool care will also be extended from September, the service will be available each day from 1.30pm to 5.30pm. If you are interested in enrolling your child or would like to learn more about the before and after school services please contact our school office on 053 9247622 or email principal.scoileoinbaiste@gmail.com.
GAA Lotto
Numbers drawn on Wed 26th March were No’s 2, 3, 13, 17. No Jackpot winner. Match 3s Suzanne Doyle, Sean Rochford. Numbers drawn on Wed 9th April were No’s 3, 5, 10, 20. No Jackpot winner. Match 3s Paud Moriarty, Paddy Carr, Brendan Doyle, Joanne Rochford, Bridie Galavan, Larry & Lorcan Crean, Maciej Paluch, Michael Hughes, David Dunne, Mick & Eimear Walsh, Tommy & Marie Plummer. Next Draw 23rd April. Next Jackpot €1400.
Bree Midsummer Fest
Booking is now open for the Bree Midsummer Fest on Friday 13th June. Line up includes Ceol, Sean Magee and Stacey Breen. Tickets from Eventbrite.
CLONARD
Clonard Lotto
Results for Wednesday 2nd April: winning numbers 1, 15, 20, 27. No Jackpot Winner. Six Match 3 Winners receive €125 each: Donna O’Brien; Kerry Sinnott; Shirley Wilson; M-A-S-H; Nuala Breen, and Dan Browne.
Jackpot for Wednesday 16th April is €12,250. Lotto draw takes place every Wednesday night at 8.30 p.m. Tickets is €2 each. Play online at www.clonardparish.ie, with your local promoter or in the Parish Office.
If you wish to become a promoter, please call to the Parish Office to have it arranged. Results are also available on www.clonardparish.ie from Thursday each week.
Clonard Bethany Bereavement Support
There is a Drop-in Service on the 2nd Friday of every month in the Shamrock Room of Clonard Community Centre from 7.30pm – 8.30pm. Next Drop-In Service takes place on Friday 9th May.
Have you experienced loss? Feel free to drop in for a cuppa and a chat. All are welcome. This service is supported by trained volunteers.
Church news
Confirmation - Congratulations to all the pupils from Scoil Mhuire who made their Confirmation recently.
Easter Ceremonies In Clonard - Holy Thursday no 10am Mass, 7.00pm - Mass of the Lord’s Supper. Good Friday no 10am Mass. 12.00pm - Stations of the Cross for Children. 3.00pm - The Passion of the Lord. 8.00pm - Prayer around the Cross. Holy Saturday: 7.00pm Easter Vigil. Easter Sunday: 9.30am, 11.30am Mass. From Monday 21st April to Friday 25th April, Mass will be at 11am daily. Normal Mass times resume on Saturday 6th April with the Vigil Mass at 6pm.
Youth Pilgrimage To Medjugorje - The Diocese of Ferns are busy preparing for their upcoming Youth Pilgrimage to Medjugorje taking place from 26th April to 1st May. Clergy, youth leaders and teachers will accompany 24 young people and anyone that has been to Medjugorje before will appreciate how wonderful an opportunity this is for them. We ask for your prayers for the success of the pilgrimage for our young people. For further information please do not hesitate to contact Colette O’Doherty (Director of Youth Ministry) on 087-9474513.
Family Liturgy Group - Practice every Wednesday from 7pm to 8pm. All children who have completed senior infants are very welcome to join the group. For further information please contact the Parish Office.
Eucharistic Adoration - Adoration takes place every Monday (including Bank Holidays) after morning Mass. Also, on the First Friday after Mass until 12 noon. New Adorers are always welcome, please leave your details in the Parish Office.
Eucharistic Adoration in Clonard Day Chapel on the first Sunday of every month from 2pm to 5pm. Please join us to pray for the unborn, disabled and elderly.
Clonard Bingo - celebrating 50 years
Clonard Bingo is celebrating 50 Years on Wednesday 16th April in Clonard Community Centre at 8pm (doors open at 7pm). There will be extra prize money on the night.
Cake Sale and Raffle
A Cake Sale and Raffle in aid of Wexford Special Olympics will take place on Saturday 19th April 11am to 3pm in Coolcotts Community Centre.
WEXARA meeting
Wexford Active Retirement are holding a General Meeting on Wednesday 30th April at 2.30pm at Clonard Community Centre. This meeting is to update members on the status of WEXARA, to inform members of alternative activities and to re-imburse membership fees where applicable.
Your news
Would you like to promote your club or your community organisation in the Wexford People District Notes? Please contact Jim on 085 8665221 or by e mail: jimnolansmail@gmail.com
